On Wednesday 02 April 2003 09:46, javainsel wrote:

> Now the great thing: When you compile your code the implementation
> can be checked whether it obeys the contract. If not, a compile error
> is thrown. 

I would appreciate a compiler that can do that, but I doubt there is 
one (for any language).

> And it can use invariants which JUnit will always lack of.

What invariants can't you test using setUp and tearDown or mock 
objects?

Robert
